name: Strength Training
description: Strength exercises, also called 'strength training' or 'resistance training', help build up your muscles and bones, reducing the risk of weak bones and slouching.

exercise_types.name: Push-ups
instructions: Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart.
Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor, then push back up.
Engage your core and keep your body in a straight line throughout the movement.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

exercise_types.name: Squats
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointed slightly outward.
Lower your body by bending your knees and pushing your hips back as if sitting in a chair.
Keep your chest up and back straight, and lower until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
Push through your heels to return to the starting position.

exercise_types.name: Dumbbell Curls
instructions: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended at your sides.
Curl the weights toward your shoulders while keeping your elbows close to your body.
Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, then lower the weights back down with control.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Flexibility
description: Flexibility exercises stretch your muscles and help your body stay limber, improving range of motion, posture, and circulation.

exercise_types.name: Hamstring Stretch
instructions: Sit on the floor with one leg extended and the other bent.
Lean forward from your hips until you feel a stretch in the back of your thigh.
Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then switch legs.
Repeat as desired.

exercise_types.name: Shoulder Stretch
instructions: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart.
Bring one arm across your body and use your other hand to gently pull it closer to your chest.
Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then switch arms.
Repeat as desired.

exercise_types.name: Cobra Stretch
instructions: Lie face down on the floor with your palms near your shoulders.
Press into your hands to lift your chest off the floor, keeping your hips and legs relaxed.
Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then lower back down.
Repeat as desired.

name: Endurance
description: Endurance, or aerobic exercise, increases your breathing and heart rate. By doing endurance exercises, you are working to keep your heart, lungs, and circulatory system healthy while improving your total fitness.

exercise_types.name: Dancing
instructions: Start with a warm-up by stretching your muscles.
Move your body to the rhythm of the music, incorporating different dance styles.
Focus on keeping a steady pace and breathing rhythmically.
Cool down with some gentle stretches.

exercise_types.name: Swimming
instructions: Warm up by swimming a few laps at a slow pace.
Increase your intensity by swimming faster or using different strokes.
Continue for a set duration or distance.
Cool down with some easy laps and stretching.

exercise_types.name: Cycling
instructions: Adjust your bike seat to the correct height.
Start pedaling at a moderate pace, focusing on smooth, even strokes.
Gradually increase your speed or resistance.
Cool down with a slower pace and stretching.

name: Balance Exercises
description: Balance exercises help prevent falls and maintain independence, especially in older adults. They focus on improving stability and coordination.

exercise_types.name: Standing on One Leg
instructions: Stand on one leg while keeping your knee slightly bent.
Hold the position for 10-30 seconds, then switch legs.
Focus on a spot in front of you to help maintain balance.
Repeat as desired.

exercise_types.name: Heel-to-Toe Walk
instructions: Position your heel directly in front of the toes of your other foot.
Walk in a straight line, placing one foot in front of the other with each step.
Keep your arms out to the sides for balance, and maintain a steady pace.
Repeat for a set distance or duration.
